text: Uranie Alphonsine Colin-Libour (19 September 1831 – 1916) was a French painter. Colin-Libour was born in Paris and became a pupil of François Bonvin, Charles Louis Lucien Muller, and François Rude.Uranie Alphonsine Colin Libour in the RKD She exhibited at Chicago World Exposition in 1893.1893 Chicago World's Fair and Exposition Her painting Charity was included in the 1905 book Women Painters of the World.Women painters of the world, from the time of Caterina Vigri, 1413-1463, to Rosa Bonheur and the present day, by Walter Shaw Sparrow, The Art and Life Library, Hodder & Stoughton, 27 Paternoster Row, London, 1905 File:Uranie Alphonsine Colin-Libour - Charity.jpg|Charity == References == *Uranie Alphonsine Colin-Libour on artnet Category:1831 births Category:1916 deaths Category:People from Paris Category:19th-century French painters Category:French women painters Category:19th-century French women artists Category:20th-century French painters Category:20th-century French women artists
title: Uranie Alphonsine Colin-Libour
